Name: Architecture of the GSM-UMTS platform

Name: UMTS Terrestrial Radio Access Network
UMTS 1800, UMTS 1900
Impacted_TSs_and_TRs: 25.307 CR#0002, 0003 Inclusion of release independent RF related information

Name: Mandatory speech codec for narrowband telephony service
Notes: Define the default speech codec for UMTS (both for FDD and TDD). Definition limited to selection of one codec among several existing ones/proposed codecs: GSM AMR, IS127 EVRC, ITU G.729 and MPEG-4 speech codec.

Name: Codec for low bitrate multimedia telephony service
3G Audio-Visual Terminal characteristics
Updates_for_UMTS
UMTS
UMTS and GSM Features
Multimedia Messaging Service
Notes: MMS allows users to send/receive messages e.g. almost unlimited text length, images, audio and video clips and new content types. R99 only includes the concept. MMS stage 3 is not included in 23.140. Rel-4 adds detailed architecture and protocols.

Name: Location Services
Notes: LCS provide ability to localize a terminal

Name: Customised Application for Mobile network Enhanced Logic Phase 3
Notes: CAMEL is a network feature providing mechanisms to support services of operators which are not covered by standardised services, even when roaming outside the HPLMN.

Name: Global view
Multiple Subscriber Profile (MSP) based on CAMEL phase 3
Notes: MSP is an optional service enabling mobile subscribers to have several profiles associated with a single IMSI, with each profile being a subscription option. Each profile may be used for mobile originated and mobile terminated calls.

Name: Short Message Service enhancements / Enhanced Messaging Service (EMS)
Notes: SMS for 3G terminals compatible with GSM SMS. Added Enhanced Messaging Service (EMS) allowing small pictures, sounds, animations to be transferred via SMS.

Name: Mobile Station Execution Environment
Notes: MExE provides a standardized MS execution environment and ability to negotiate its supported capabilities with a MExE SP. R99 enhances SIM MExE certificate management, security clarifications, QoS and defines two MExE classmarks WAP/Personal-Java based.

Name: MS_Classmark
Notes: MExE classmark identifies a category of MExE UE supporting MExE functionality with a minimum level of processing, memory, display, and interactive capabilities. Several MExE classmarks may be defined.

Name: MultiCall
Notes: Multicall allows several simultaneous CS calls with dedicated bearers of independent traffic and performance characteristics. R99 Multicall was defined as a supplementary service limited to one CS bearer to be used for speech at any time.

Name: Stage 1 for Multicall
Virtual Home Environment
Notes: Information exists in SP#5-8 reports & in SP-99416,SP-000095,SP 000155. OSA allows service development by operators and 3rd parties by making use of network functionality through open, standardised, secure, extensible and scalable interfaces.

Name: Open Service Access
Notes: Open Service Architecture became in later Releases Open Service Access. Produced by Parlay, ETSI SPAN (TISPAN), 3GPP SA1 (Stage 1), SA2 (Stage 2) and CN5 (Stage 3), resulting in a single set of standard OSA APIs for the whole development community.

Name: Super Charger mechanism for signalling traffic associated with mobility
Notes: Super Charger reduces mobility management cost by reducing the volume of location update signalling. It changes subscriber data management associated with inter-VLR and SGSN location updates. It also applies to packet services (SGSN replaces VLR and

Name: Follow_Me service
Notes: Follow Me enables a mobile subscriber A to manipulate the Follow Me data of a party B in such a way that - under certain conditions - subsequent calls directed to party B will be forwarded to subscriber A. It is PLMN-specific and control based on USSD

Name: Wide area network Synchronization and object exchange
Notes: Allows data stored in ME/USIM to be synchronized with the outside world. TS 27.103 defines protocols based upon IrMC level 4 and will evaluate new technologies (XML) for inclusion. From Rel-4 IrMC was replaced by SyncML in 27.103.

Name: R99 Terminal Interfaces
AT commands for 3GPP
Notes: AT commands to control a 3G ME via an external Terminal Equipment (TE), fully compatible with GSM AT commands. R99 adds new AT commands e.g. to control Advanced Speech Call Items (ASCI) services.

Name: Physical interfaces
Notes: Conclusion: 3GPP should not produce any technical specification for terminal interfaces other than radio interface and USIM interface. SDOs could develop own optional physical connector specification based on market requirements

Name: Multiplexer
Notes: Multiplexing protocol allowing a number of simultaneous sessions between a MS and a terminal; used to send any data (voice, SMS, USSD, fax etc.). 27.010 describes the protocol, but not the commands or data transported with it.

Name: Bearer Services
Circuit Switched Bearer Services
Notes: CS and real-time data services provided for interworking with PSTN/ISDN so that user is unaware of access network used (UMTS, GSM or handover between ANs). Transparent(constant delay) & non-transparent(zero error with flow control) services are supported

Name: Stage 1 for Circuit Switched Bearer Services
Notes: CS and real-time data services provided for interworking with PSTN/ISDN so that user is unaware of access network used (UMTS, GSM or handover between ANs). Transparent(constant delay) & non-transparent(zero error with flow control) services are supported

Name: CS_Bearers
CS_Bearerss
CS_Data
CS_Data_Bearers
Deleted - CN3 poart of Circuit Switched Bearer Services
Notes: No CR or new TS/TR approved under this WI

Name: Frame Tunnelling Mode
Notes: FTM is a type of async non-transparent CS bearer service (22.002). Generic term for HDLC and HDLC-related transmission protocols. Converts async non-transp data stream towards mobile side & sync data stream using X.31 flag stuffing on fixed network side.

Name: Access to ISPs and Intranets  Wireless/Remote access to LANs
Notes: Access to an Intranet or ISP by running DHCP between the TE and a server in the Intranet/ISP domain.

Name: PHS Internet Access Forum Specification
Notes: PIAFS is one type of CS bearer data service (22.002). It refers to async CS tx protocol over ISDN 64 kbit/s unrestricted digital line. Facilitates interworking between PHS-MS and UMTS-UE & UMTS-UE and existing PIAFS TA (Terminal Adapter).

Name: Personal Handyphone System Internet Access Forum Standard (PIAFS)
Notes: PIAFS was originally standardised by the PHS Internet Access Forum in Japan. More information can be found at: http://www.infopro.or.jp/piaf

Name: Support_of_PIAFS_in_UMTS
Universal Integrated Circuit Card (UICC) and Universal Subscriber Identity Module (USIM)
Notes: For 3G, GSM 11.11 was divided into two parts: a platform comprised of basic physical, electrical and logical specification (31.101) and an application specification (31.102)

Name: UICC / Terminal interface; Physical and logical characteristics
Notes: Defines a generic Terminal/Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) interface. Is independent of 3G USIM application => platform for any IC card application. Ensures interoperability between ICC and terminal independently of manufacturer, card issuer or operator.
Impacted_TSs_and_TRs: 31.101 (Since 10/2000, ETSI EP SCP is responsible for the generic Terminal/Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) interface TS 102 221)

Name: UICC/(U)SIM enhancements and interworking
Characteristics of the USIM application
Notes: Defines Universal Subscriber Identity Module (USIM) application for 3G telecom network operation & resides on UICC, an IC card specified in 31.101. UICC can be used as a multi-application card: several USIMs and/or other applications can co-exist

Name: UICC Application Identifiers
Notes: Defines and administers Application IDentifiers (AID) for UICC. AID is used to address an application in the card. Consists of Registered application provider ID (RID) & Proprietary application ID exception (PIX - according to ISO/IEC 7816-5).

Name: SIM Application Toolkit
USIM Application Toolkit
Notes: Defines UICC - ME interface, and mandatory ME procedures for USAT. Based on GSM 11.14 (SIM Application Toolkit). Commands and procedures defined in USIM and 3G Terminal for using USAT.  Service and security requirements defined in 22.100 and 22.101.

Name: Bearer Independent Protocol for SAT applications to exchange data over the GSM network
Notes: Defines at SIM-ME interface a basic protocol allowing SIM Toolkit applications to determine available bearers and to exchange data by selecting using the most appropriate bearer available (CS data, GPRS, SMS, Unstructured Supplementary Service Data (USSD)

Name: Administrative commands and functions for IC cards
Notes: Defines function and syntax of administrative commands for telecommunication IC Card used during installation, activation and de-activation of applications. Compliant to ISO/IEC 7816 series. Handed over to ETSI Project Smart Card Platform (SCP) in 2000.

Name: USIM and UICC requirements
Notes: High level requirements for 3GPP IC card and its interface to 3GPP terminal (USIM&UICC reqs). Service&security reqs in 322.01,22.00. USIM is a 3GPP application on an IC card. Inter-operates with 3GPP terminals and provides access to 3GPP services

Name: SIM_API
SIM_toolkit_API
Deleted - 1.8 Volt SIM ME interface
Notes: No CR or new TS/TR approved under this WI

Name: USIM/UICC Testing
Terminal tests for the UICC Interface
Notes: Test spec for the interface between UICC and terminal (originally based GSM 11.10-1 clause 27). Ensures UICC - terminal interoperability independently of manufacturer, card issuer or operator. Tests for applications residing on UICC are in 31.121

Name: USIM application test specification
Notes: Application test spec originally based on GSM 11.17. Aspects related to UICC administrative management phase are not defined. Any internal technical realisation of either UICC or terminal is only specified where these are reflected over the interface.

Name: USIM conformance test specification
Notes: Conformance Test specification for UICC defined in 31.101 with USIM defined in 31.102.

Name: SIM toolkit test specification
Notes: SIM Application Toolkit (SAT) has major impact on ME design and enhances SIM/ME interface. Contains tests for SIM/ME interface optional features (no network related signalling issues involved). Doesn't form basis for any type approval or regulatory tests.

Name: Security for UMTS and GSM Features
Fraud Information Gathering Service (for connection-orientated services)
Notes: HPLMN can monitor its subscribers in VPLMN, which collects info on a defined set of monitored subscribers activities & sends it to HPLMN, which can perform service limitation control eg Operator Determined Barring (ODB) and IST to limit financial exposure

Name: Immediate Service Termination / SECurity Immediate Service Termination
Notes: HPLMN can terminate all activities of its subscriber in VPLMN, if decides (based on info via eg FIGS) that a roaming subscriber is behaving in fraudulent/suspicious way. HPLMN can terminate all subscriber activities including calls in progress.

Name: Core_Network_Security
GSM Features
Dual Transfer Mode within GSM and GPRS
Notes: 2-99-1780 (2-99-H80 from SMG2#32) WID on BSS co-ordination of Radio Resource allocation for class A GPRS services - GSM Radio Access (R99)

Name: Class A Dual Transfer Mode
Dual Transfer Mode
General Packet Radio Service enahancements
Notes: GPRS was introduced in Release 97. Release 99 brings a number of essential corrections e.g. on Downlink Power Control, Timing Advance procedure, Cell reselection delay time, PBCCH scheduling, PTCCH mapping, etc.

Name: General Packet Radio Service
GPRS2
Notes: Introduction of EGPRS (S1) + Introduction of Reserved Service Labels in the APN (N2)

Name: GPRS Tunnelling Protocol enhancement
Enhanced Data rates for GSM Evolution - Phase 1
Notes: EDGE is independent of the frequency bands, so it can be deployed e.g. in 900 and 1900 MHz bands. The new physical layer based on 8-PSK modulation is introduced and EGPRS and ECSD facilitate the new modulation in single and multi slot constellation.

Name: Enhanced Data rates for GSM Evolution
EDGE-Layer1
High Speed Circuit Switched Data
Enhanced Circuit Switched Data - Phase 1
Notes: ECSD supports both transparent and non-transparent services, up to 64 kbit/s and 57.6 kbit/s respectively. See Tdoc SMG2 670/99 ECSD Concept Evaluation for more info

Name: EDGE-Enhanced Circuit Switched Data
Enhanced GPRS - Phase 1

Packet Flow Context (PFC)
Support for EGPRS in ANSI-136 networks and EDGE COMPACT
Notes: Support for EGPRS in ANSI-136 networks and EDGE Compact (for ANSI-136 networks only). COMPACT = Deployment of services in spectrum below 1 MHz

Name: EGPRS COMPACT
Notes: COMPACT = Deployment of services in spectrum below 1 MHz

Name: COMPACT
Notes: COMPACT = Deployment of services in spectrum below 1 MHz

Name: GSM_400
Notes: GSM in the 400 MHz bands allows to deploy GSM within frequency bands in the range 450 to 500 MHz, previously used for analogue cellular systems. See Tdoc SMG2 190/99 and 595/99 for further info.

GSM_700

Name: GSM mobile number portability euro MNP / North American MNP
Notes: R98 MNP: mobile subscriber ability to change PLMN operator within the same country whilst retaining its original MS ISDN number (MSISDN). IMSI is changed, only MSISDN is kept. R99 adds requirements for North American Service Provider Number Portability.

Name: Mobile Number Portability
Automatic establishment of roaming relations
Notes: framework for commercial and technical interworking between UMTS Home Environments and Serving Networks who have no direct prior commercial agreements with each other.

Name: Advanced addressing
UMTS numbering, addressing and identities
Notes: Also new requirements for Single and Multiple Numbering scheme was added (CR#20 and 21). Deleted the term International Mobile User Identifier (IMUI) and changed IMSI (International Mobile Station Identifier=>International Mobile Subscriber Identity.

Name: Lawful Interception for GSM Features transposed to UMTS
Notes: Defines an interception system in UMTS that supports a number of regional interception regulations. Regional interception requirements shall be met in using specific (regional) mediation functions allowing only required information to be transported.

R99 UE Conformance Testing
Notes: Specifies Conformance Tests for a 3G UE to be recognised as 3GPP-standard compliant. A 3GPP-external body, GCF (Global Certification Forum), delivers certificates to prove that a UE has correctly passed tests and is then conform to the 3GPP standard.

Name: Common test environments for User Equipment (UE); Conformance testing
Terminal conformance specification, Radio transmission and reception (FDD)
Notes: measurement procedures for the conformance test of the UE that contain transmitting characteristics, receiving characteristics and performance requirements in addition to requirements for support of RRM (Radio Resource Management) in FDD mode.

Name: Terminal conformance specification, Radio transmission and reception (TDD)
Notes: measurement procedures for the conformance test of the UE that contain transmitting characteristics, receiving characteristics and performance requirements in addition to requirements for support of RRM (Radio Resource Management) in TDD mode.

Name: UE conformance specification; Part 1: Protocol conformance specification
Notes: TS 34.123, composed of three parts, actually specifies the protocol conformance testing for the 3G UE. Part 1 describes the overall test structure.

Name: UE conformance specification; Part 2: Implementation Conformance Statement (ICS) specification
Notes: Part 2 contains the applicability of each test case defined as the Implementation Conformance Statement (ICS) proforma, in compliance with the relevant requirements, and in accordance with the relevant guidance given in ISO/IEC 9646-7 and ETS 300 406.

Name: UE conformance specification; Part 3: Abstract test suites (ATSs)
Notes: Part 3 specifies the protocol conformance testing in TTCN for the 3G UE at the Uu interface. It defines the TTCN test specification and design considerations in Abstract Test Suites based on the test cases specified in prose in part 1.
